intro: Cochlearia scapiflora, commonly known as the scapiflorous cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has a compact growth habit with basal leaves and a single flowering stem. Cochlearia scapiflora is often found in open habitats such as tundra and mountain slopes.
